segment.source: Maps and location overview
segment.target: Maps and location overview

segment.source: This section explains how you can display maps, use map services, find the location, and set up a geofence in your app.
segment.target: This section explains how you can display maps, use map services, find the location, and set up a geofence in your app.

segment.source: This section also shows you how to launch the Windows Maps app to a specific map, route, or a set of turn-by-turn directions.
segment.target: This section also shows you how to launch the Windows Maps app to a specific map, route, or a set of turn-by-turn directions.

segment.source: Maps and location overview
segment.target: Maps and location overview

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: This section explains how you can display maps, use map services, find the location, and set up a geofence in your app.
segment.target: This section explains how you can display maps, use map services, find the location, and set up a geofence in your app.

segment.source: This section also shows you how to launch the Windows Maps app to a specific map, route, or a set of turn-by-turn directions.
segment.target: This section also shows you how to launch the Windows Maps app to a specific map, route, or a set of turn-by-turn directions.

segment.source: Tip To learn more about using maps and location in your app, download the following samples from the Windows-universal-samples repo on GitHub:
segment.target: Tip To learn more about using maps and location in your app, download the following samples from the Windows-universal-samples repo on GitHub:

segment.source: Universal Windows Platform (UWP) map sample
segment.target: Universal Windows Platform (UWP) map sample

segment.source: UWP geolocation sample
segment.target: UWP geolocation sample

segment.source: Display maps
segment.target: Display maps

segment.source: Display maps with 2D, 3D, or Streetside views in your app by using APIs from the Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.Maps namespace.
segment.target: Display maps with 2D, 3D, or Streetside views in your app by using APIs from the Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.Maps namespace.

segment.source: You can mark points of interest (POI) on the map by using pushpins, images, shapes, or XAML UI elements.
segment.target: You can mark points of interest (POI) on the map by using pushpins, images, shapes, or XAML UI elements.

segment.source: You can also overlay tiled images or replace the map images altogether.
segment.target: You can also overlay tiled images or replace the map images altogether.

segment.source: Topic
segment.target: Topic

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Request a maps authentication key
segment.target: Request a maps authentication key

segment.source: Your app must be authenticated before it can use the MapControl and map services in the Windows.Services.Maps namespace.
segment.target: Your app must be authenticated before it can use the MapControl and map services in the Windows.Services.Maps namespace.

segment.source: To authenticate your app, you must specify a maps authentication key.
segment.target: To authenticate your app, you must specify a maps authentication key.

segment.source: This article describes how to request a maps authentication key from the Bing Maps Developer Center and add it to your app.
segment.target: This article describes how to request a maps authentication key from the Bing Maps Developer Center and add it to your app.

segment.source: Display maps with 2D, 3D, and Streetside views
segment.target: Display maps with 2D, 3D, and Streetside views

segment.source: Display customizable maps in your app by using the MapControl class.
segment.target: Display customizable maps in your app by using the MapControl class.

segment.source: This topic also introduces aerial 3D and Streetside views.
segment.target: This topic also introduces aerial 3D and Streetside views.

segment.source: Display points of interest (POI) on a map
segment.target: Display points of interest (POI) on a map

segment.source: Add points of interest (POI) to a map by using pushpins, images, shapes, and XAML UI elements.
segment.target: Add points of interest (POI) to a map by using pushpins, images, shapes, and XAML UI elements.

segment.source: Overlay tiled images on a map
segment.target: Overlay tiled images on a map

segment.source: Overlay third-party or custom tiled images on a map by using tile sources.
segment.target: Overlay third-party or custom tiled images on a map by using tile sources.

segment.source: Use tile sources to overlay specialized information such as weather data, population data, or seismic data; or use tile sources to replace the default map entirely.
segment.target: Use tile sources to overlay specialized information such as weather data, population data, or seismic data; or use tile sources to replace the default map entirely.

segment.source: Design guidelines for maps
segment.target: Design guidelines for maps

segment.source: The map control can display road maps and aerial views, directions, search results, and traffic.
segment.target: The map control can display road maps and aerial views, directions, search results, and traffic.

segment.source: Design guidelines for location-aware apps
segment.target: Design guidelines for location-aware apps

segment.source: Performance guidelines for apps that require access to a user's location.
segment.target: Performance guidelines for apps that require access to a user's location.

segment.source: Access map services
segment.target: Access map services

segment.source: Add routes, directions, and geocoding capabilities to your app by using APIs from the Windows.Services.Maps namespace.
segment.target: Add routes, directions, and geocoding capabilities to your app by using APIs from the Windows.Services.Maps namespace.

segment.source: You can also help the user manage offline maps by launching the Settings app directly to the appropriate page.
segment.target: You can also help the user manage offline maps by launching the Settings app directly to the appropriate page.

segment.source: Topic
segment.target: Topic

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Display routes and directions
segment.target: Display routes and directions

segment.source: Request routes and directions, and display them in your app.
segment.target: Request routes and directions, and display them in your app.

segment.source: Perform geocoding and reverse geocoding
segment.target: Perform geocoding and reverse geocoding

segment.source: Convert addresses to geographic locations (geocoding) and convert geographic locations to addresses (reverse geocoding) by calling the methods of the MapLocationFinder class in the Windows.Services.Maps namespace.
segment.target: Convert addresses to geographic locations (geocoding) and convert geographic locations to addresses (reverse geocoding) by calling the methods of the MapLocationFinder class in the Windows.Services.Maps namespace.

segment.source: Get the user's location
segment.target: Get the user's location

segment.source: Get the user's current location and be notified when the location changes in your app by using APIs from the Windows.Devices.Geolocation namespace.
segment.target: Get the user's current location and be notified when the location changes in your app by using APIs from the Windows.Devices.Geolocation namespace.

segment.source: These API members are also frequently used in parameters of the maps APIs.
segment.target: These API members are also frequently used in parameters of the maps APIs.

segment.source: APIs from the Windows.Devices.Geolocation.Geofencing namespace notifies your app when the user enters or exits a geofence (a predefined geographical area).
segment.target: APIs from the Windows.Devices.Geolocation.Geofencing namespace notifies your app when the user enters or exits a geofence (a predefined geographical area).

segment.source: Topic
segment.target: Topic

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.target: Request a maps authentication key

segment.source: Your app must be authenticated before it can use the MapControl and map services in the Windows.Services.Maps namespace.
segment.target: Your app must be authenticated before it can use the MapControl and map services in the Windows.Services.Maps namespace.

segment.source: To authenticate your app, you must specify a maps authentication key.
segment.target: To authenticate your app, you must specify a maps authentication key.

segment.source: This article describes how to request a maps authentication key from the Bing Maps Developer Center and add it to your app.
segment.target: This article describes how to request a maps authentication key from the Bing Maps Developer Center and add it to your app.

segment.target: Perform geocoding and reverse geocoding

segment.source: Convert addresses to geographic locations (geocoding) and convert geographic locations to addresses (reverse geocoding) by calling the methods of the MapLocationFinder class.
segment.target: Convert addresses to geographic locations (geocoding) and convert geographic locations to addresses (reverse geocoding) by calling the methods of the MapLocationFinder class.

segment.target: Display maps with 2D, 3D, and Streetside views

segment.target: Display customizable maps in your app by using the MapControl class.

segment.source: This topic also introduces aerial 3D and Streetside views.
segment.target: This topic also introduces aerial 3D and Streetside views.

segment.source: Set up a geofence
segment.target: Set up a geofence

segment.source: Set up a Geofence in your app, and learn how to handle notifications in the foreground and background.
segment.target: Set up a Geofence in your app, and learn how to handle notifications in the foreground and background.

segment.source: Launch the Windows Maps app
segment.target: Launch the Windows Maps app

segment.source: Your app can launch the Windows Maps app as shown here to display specific maps and turn-by-turn directions.
segment.target: Your app can launch the Windows Maps app as shown here to display specific maps and turn-by-turn directions.

segment.source: Rather than provide map functionality directly in your own app, consider using the Windows Maps app to provide that functionality.
segment.target: Rather than provide map functionality directly in your own app, consider using the Windows Maps app to provide that functionality.

segment.source: For more info, see Launch the Windows Maps app.
segment.target: For more info, see Launch the Windows Maps app.

segment.target: an example of the windows maps app.
